title: Chunker: local to local chunker transfers ignores "hash_type = md5all" config setting and acts as "md5"

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
None.


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When I am trying to copy from 'local' to 'local->chunker' and 'hash_type = md5all' config setting or '--chunker-hash-type md5all' flag is set, the files which are smaller than 'chunk_size' (e.g.: 1P) don't have their metadata file created and "forcefully chunked" original file renamed with additional 'name_format' file extension for chunked files. Basically I get identical copy (with 'chunk_size = 1P' or similar). I want to use that 'md5all' thing, so my files I want to upload have md5 checksums pre-calculated before upload. That way the upload would be much faster (uploading to Jottacloud requires md5 checksum in advance).


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```rclone v1.56.0```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows 10, 64 bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Local


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```rclone copy local:D:\Data local-chunk:D:\Data-chunked --chunker-hash-type md5all -P --fast-list --transfers=1```
That is my pseudo command.

From rclone config file (pseudo example):
```
[local]
type = local
nounc = false

[local-chunk]
type = chunker
remote = local:
chunk_size = 1P
name_format = *.#
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
I think there is no need for the log as the problem is very obvious, clear and reproduceable (I think so).


<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->
I hope there is enough information from my pseudo examples. The best thing would be if rclone could use md5 checksum files for that. NTFS file system don't store file checksums. It seems that similar feature is currently worked on and should be released with the next rclone version: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/949. I am really happy about that.
